rev.desc.rev.desc: Some columns are lost in the process of exporting
The visible condtion in format is ignored when export a QBE list
QCCR1E58562
Redesign Export to Excel to not use DDE.
In final release we fixed 3 more issues:
1. Unicode is not supported in beta. Therefore, a single server instance could support French and German, English and Turkish, English and Japanese, but not Turkish and Czech, or Polish and Japanese.
(We have 5 options, and we choose the last one: utf8 + delimiter defined in OS, utf8 + "tab", utf16 + delimiter defined in OS, utf16 + "tab", utf16le + "tab")
2. QCCR1E47649. Columns in a QBE whose visible condition evaluates to false can be exported to Excel.
(We only consider the visible condition defined in datapolicy, we don't consider the visible condition defined in format)
3. Carriage returns are not supported in non-array fields in beta. QCIM1E61015 report this issue again. Export to Excel does not properly export & format the spreadsheet from Knowledge Documents.
(I tested on my laptop, the performance is the same)
the fix of dde.export.fetchrows is for the 2nd issue.
Panel start
Removed unneeded $L.els.* variables
Panel file.init
Changed normal exit to select.gui
Panel check.select
Deleted panel
Panel extract
Replaced all content of the panel with new logic to find the input and caption values for the columns.
Modified as per Mike Price.

Added "f ($L.char=$L.tab) then $L.count=$L.stop; " to statement "for $L.i = 1 to $L.max do ($L.char=substr($L.source, $L.i, 1); if ($L.char="C") then ($L.a=substr($L.source, $L.i+1, 1); $L.b=substr($L.source, $L.i+2, 1); $L.c=substr($L.source, $L.i+3, 1); $L.d=substr($L.source, $L.i+4, 1); $L.e=substr($L.source, $L.i+5, 1); $L.f=substr($L.source, $L.i+6, 1); if ($L.a="o" and $L.b="l" and $L.c="u" and $L.d="m" and $L.e="n" and $L.f="s") then ($L.i+=8;$L.char=substr($L.source, $L.i, 1);while ($L.count<$L.stop) do ($L.count+=1;$L.x=$L.i;$L.char=substr($L.source, $L.i, 1);while ($L.char~=";" and $L.char~=$L.tab) do ($L.i+=1;$L.char=substr($L.source, $L.i, 1));$L.y=$L.i - $L.x;$L.i+=1;if ($L.char=$L.tab) then $L.count=$L.stop;
$L.char=substr($L.source, $L.i, 1);$L.temp=substr($L.source,$L.x,$L.y); $.column.array=insert($L.column.array, $L.count, 1, $L.temp));$L.i=$L.max ) ) ) " on panel extract.

Bug in panel extract in that the routine was being thrown off if there were fields OTHER THAN a table in the form being processed. Remedied this by putting code in there that deletes all fields (from the array called field) prior to the first table field. This way, the routine is fooled into thinking that it is processing only table field definitions. At the end of the routine, the fields (the array called field) is restored to its original state (just in case any subsequent panels process it).
Fixed the extract panel so that it won't loop continuously if there isn't a table on the form. Needed to be able to export old-style lists (non-table).
added check for picking up columns, field on a form that has a qbe have inputs, which was what the old check was, now the check is for input and caption to not be null, to be part of the excel file.
Added call to the us.get.qbe.format application if no qbe format selected. This is to build a qbe format if one does not exist.

descript.descript: Some columns are lost in the process of exporting
The visible condtion in format is ignored when export a QBE list
QCCR1E58562
Redesign Export to Excel to not use DDE.
In final release we fixed 3 more issues:
1. Unicode is not supported in beta. Therefore, a single server instance could support French and German, English and Turkish, English and Japanese, but not Turkish and Czech, or Polish and Japanese.
(We have 5 options, and we choose the last one: utf8 + delimiter defined in OS, utf8 + "tab", utf16 + delimiter defined in OS, utf16 + "tab", utf16le + "tab")
2. QCCR1E47649. Columns in a QBE whose visible condition evaluates to false can be exported to Excel.
(We only consider the visible condition defined in datapolicy, we don't consider the visible condition defined in format)
3. Carriage returns are not supported in non-array fields in beta. QCIM1E61015 report this issue again. Export to Excel does not properly export & format the spreadsheet from Knowledge Documents.
(I tested on my laptop, the performance is the same)
the fix of dde.export.fetchrows is for the 2nd issue.

Modified as per Mike Price.

$L.char=substr($L.source, $L.i, 1);$L.temp=substr($L.source,$L.x,$L.y); $.column.array=insert($L.column.array, $L.count, 1, $L.temp));$L.i=$L.max ) ) ) " on panel extract.

At the end of the routine, the fields (the array called field) is restored to its original state (just in case any subsequent panels process it).

Added call to the us.get.qbe.format application if no qbe format selected. This is to build a qbe format if one does not exist.
